channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Multiphase aqueous soggy sand electrolyte for zinc metal batteries applications at elevated temperatures
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 04 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67020-z

Aqueous zinc metal batteries often face performance decay under thermal environments, originating from side reactions caused by aqueous electrolytes. Here, authors report an organic-inorganic-H2O multiphase aqueous soggy-sand electrolyte that reconstructs hydrogen-bond networks, eliminates parasitic reactions, and promotes uniform Zn deposition at elevated temperature (140 oC).
item.dc:title: Multiphase aqueous soggy sand electrolyte for zinc metal batteries applications at elevated temperatures
item.dc:creator: Jingxuan Ren
Jie Zhang
Yufeng Chen
Renming Liu
Chuangwei Liu
Xinli Guo
Dan Luo
Dongdong Wang
Zhongwei Chen

item.title: Hydrotrope-enabled high concentration aqueous electrolytes for reversible and sustainable iron metal anodes
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 04 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-65160-w

Iron metal batteries are hindered by poor reversibility and hydrogen evolution. Here, authors introduce a urea-based hydrotrope to create a high-concentration ferrous sulfate electrolyte, enabling stable, dendrite-free cycling and advancing cost-effective, sustainable energy storage.
item.dc:title: Hydrotrope-enabled high concentration aqueous electrolytes for reversible and sustainable iron metal anodes
item.dc:creator: Guangxia Feng
Zaichun Liu
John Holoubek
Louisa C. Greenburg
Ge Zhang
Yuqi Li
Xun Guan
Yi Cui
Pu Zhang
Adam Brest
Xueli Zheng
Yi Cui
